intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium pannosum subsp. mokragorae, commonly known as the Mokragora hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy, yellowish-green leaves and small, daisy-like flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its unique leaf morphology and habitat preferences. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open, sunny environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
